pros: Benefits, co-workers, working with students.
cons: Salary is the biggest downside. It is stagnant . There are no cost of living raises and rarely, very rarely a 1% cost of living raise. Like once every 5-10 years. Raises in a current position are almost unheard of, total unicorn. The longer you work here the less buying power you will have. The culture is going downhill as well. Employee moral is tanking, administration is seen as u trust worthy, there is a lot of lip service with no action.

job_title: Marketing Department Assistant in Wichita, KS
pros: I got to establish relationships with the marketing department faculty. I really liked some of the professors and I got to see the inner workings of how they conducted classes.
cons: While I don't believe she works there anymore, my boss was possibly the most abhorrent individual I have ever had the displeasure of working with. She was rude, derogatory, hypocritical, and not a good communicator. I cried at this job many times and I still have trouble trusting any place I work for because of the experience I had in the Marketing Department. I would rather work at McDonalds than ever be put in the same position with the same boss I had at WSU.

pros: A steady place to work.
cons: Somebody else will take the credit for anything good that you do.

pros: Works with class schedules. Opportunity for promotions.
cons: Student Managers do not manage their gossip. Pay can be lower than is reasonable (aka do your research before accepting offer). Full-time managers are now doing more work than is reasonable for their pay with no raise.

review_title: WSU Bookstore- Perfect opportunity for a low stress job while going to school
pros: Very convenient for students and get discounts on books, supplies, and shocker gear. Easy job, low stress, opportunities for creativity and growth. Full-timers are generally nice and helpful (the supplies buyer Cheryl is the best!)
cons: Probably comes with being a student employee, but management tends to treat you like a kindergartener. Given mundane tasks when business is slow, occassionally have to deal with angry students because the book is out of stock through no fault of your own, systems are out-dated.Aren't allowed to study or read books when there is NOTHING else to do. Hours of boredom until full-timers leave for the day! Pays barely over min wage and raises are a joke.

job_title: Academic Success Coach in Wichita, KS
pros: Very flexible hours, get to work with students in your major, great feeling of pride after a hard day's work, you get to see the positive impact you make on students when you see them on campus, at least once a month you'll get free food from the dozens of meetings that happen in the building. Management understands that you're a student too and will let you take off work occasionally if needed. The other academic success coaches are there to help you succeed! This is a great part-time gig where you can work as much or as little as you want and you can set your own hours.
cons: When midterms and finals roll around, you are expected to work as this is when students need you the most, so be prepared to spend late nights studying for your own tests.

review_title: Student work was a great experiance
pros: Got to work as a Graphic Designer and there were lots of opportunities to learn new skills.
cons: Nothing really it was lots of work experience with pay. No better kind of on-campus job.

pros: The culture on campus is great! Friendly, fun, engaged.  Most departments value being an involved partner in the change and improvement of the university.  The university is currently using a strategic focus to make these changes and it is creating a cultural change (for the better) that I believe will only help improve an already great university.
cons: Some indiviudals have been there a long time and the "old way of doing things" tends to impede the possibility of positive change as indicated above.  Pay is stagnant.  Government spending "buckets" does make it difficult to understand the we-are-strapped-for-cash-in-education plea.  When you spend 1K per employee on stuff you don't need, just because, it's confusing and a it demoralizing.

review_title: Great leave time - benefits reducing, stagnant salary, nice environment
pros: Nice environment - access to gym, places to eat. It's nice to be around students - we likely have a good future if they are any indication. Leave time is really good. There is generally good support for professional development opportunities.
cons: Stagnant pay - expect until KS gets its act together. I effectively make less money after 3 years than when I started due to health insurance increases and only a single 1% raise. Parking can be rough when school is in session. Your direct experience will vary highly depending upon direct management, could be great, could be so-so. I think most positions are pretty flexible - again, your mileage may vary.

job_title: Cisco Support Engineer in Wichita, KS
pros: The university provides a good starting point to break into the employment world. My supervisor was willing to work around my school schedule and I was constantly told that school should be my first priority.
cons: Pay rates tend to be less than average (slightly above minimum wage), and management took a very long time to get problems fixed. They were often unresponsive to communications, and refused to meet with me to discuss my hourly rate. I felt that very few opportunities were available after my position here, which is the primary reason I moved on.

pros: VERY flexible with your class schedule. As long as you maintain good communication with your supervisors they are very good with letting you change your hours around.
cons: The people that work in those offices have been there for years, these women have a way of working with each other and they have a system. Also, like any office a lot of the women are nosey so unless you make those personal boundaries clear they won't keep them for you.

pros: Updated technology, loved my department, was given interesting tasks, and really felt like I was part of the community.  Great to be able to work where I am going to school.
cons: Had to turn in paper time sheets which was a total pain and there was a cap on the hours I could work, I absolutely could not get overtime, even when there was work that needed to get done.

pros:
multinational students (most of the time)
flexible schedule
fellow faculty have the drive to make a difference in the school and students' lives
with such a high turn over, there are many opportunities to meet other ESL professionals before they find a better job
cons:
Careless management (forgetting the submit pay paperwork, uninformative, no teacher support, etc)
only know teaching schedule days before teaching
no true screening for new hires (hire friends of friends without true evaluation or degrees)
working without pay for pre-session testing
little compensation without raises or opportunity to grow

pros: Great facilities, great coworkers, awesome staff in chemistry, easy commute to work, student body is comprised of young and older generations, growing campus community
cons: graduate student stipends need to be higher, which will attract more graduate students - regular raises for employees - greater emphasis on improving STEM disciplines/facilities, in particular physics and computer science

pros: The department is like a family. I always felt respected and appreciated and valued. The director worked very hard to create the most opportunities possible for faculty and students.
cons: I can not complain. It would be great if the department had more financial support from the university but with what they had, they did far more than expected. This school is on the caliber of those in New York and deserves more attention.

pros:
-SEHP insurance with Healthquest discounts
-Paid holidays
-Robust support infrastructure for staff
cons:
-Working for the State means that any paperwork is going to take longer than it has to
-Various departments are constantly being asked to make budget cuts because the school is receiving less and less funding from the state, meaning deans are being pressured to hire adjuncts instead of full time faculty
-The raises are a joke

review_title: Wonderful opportunity for personal and professional growth
pros: Working with a diverse group with individuals from all around the globe.  Perfect environment for networking as many major players in the economy visit the campus daily for recruiting.  Provides frequent employee training ensuring growth.  Very rewarding experience if you enjoy working with young adults.
cons: The salary could be increased slightly.  Because you will be working with a multiplicity of diverse persons from all over the globe there can be some barriers to communication.

review_title: Great place to work and learn in an academic setting
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Wichita, KS
pros: The Dr. I worked for was wonderful. She explained what she wanted from my work and helped me achieve my goals. She even helped me author my own scholarly article for publication. I was able to work at my own pace.
cons: There were not any cons in my position. It was a great experience. The pay was adequate for my position.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Wichita, KS
pros: Wichita State University is one of the cheapest school in the mid-west with some decent facilities for the engineering major students. Working as a GTA is not that much challenging, since there are no continuous evaluation or arduous training.
cons: The main problem is the minimal payment you will earn after a month is really frustrating. In addition, some cases employees are not properly trained about the lab equipment and safety issues.

job_title: Graduate Student Assistant in Wichita, KS
pros: Very good work environment. I am a Student Assistant so this a work study position. My supervisor gives ample of opportunity for my first priority to study.
cons: Actually there are no cons. I enjoy my work over there. But if the hourly rate would have increased a little bit then it would be better for us. As international students can't work off campus this is the only earning source.

review_title: This is a great place to work, feels like family, and you have to work hard.
pros: This is a great place to work. Lots of changes happening, so be OK with ambiguity and be flexible. They're great people to work with and for. Lots of opportunity to learn new things.
cons: Sometimes it's hard to know what is expected of you by leadership. If you're not OK with the change and ambiguity this is not the place for you.

review_title: Practical engineering research environment with immense learning value.
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Wichita, KS
pros: Clear guidance but freedom of action. Flexible time, close cooperation between departments and advisers. Comprehensive manufacturing, testing and analyzing facilities.
cons: Attitudes of mid-level office assistants and supervisor is not conducive to research. Raising health and safety or security issues to show 'who is the boss', is not only counter productive but undermines the gravity of the actual subject.

pros: I love the flexible hours.  As a student it it nice being able to work certain evenings and not others.  Sometimes I am able to homework at my job.  Upper level is very nice.  I enjoy working here.
cons: At certain times of the year there is a lot more work than other times.

review_title: WSU is a great place to be, especially for a librarian.
job_title: Instructor & Instruction and Research Support Services Librarian in Wichita, KS
pros: Each librarian works approximately 8-10 hours at the reference desk or on-call reference each week and provides one-shot instruction, instruction, or workshops. The librarian also works on projects as assigned.
cons: Instruction sessions can be back-to-back during the Fall & Spring semesters, but it slows down a lot during the summer.

pros: The scheduling is flexible which helps to work around course work and exams. Also it is nice getting to work with professors and get to know other students, staff and faculty.
cons: The pay is less than ideal, which I knew going into my job. Also, getting paid two weeks after a pay period ends is difficult when you’re a student on a budget.

review_title: Best place to work at WSU for a Computer Networking Major - Advanced Networking Research Center

pros:
Work with Cisco devices 
Troubleshoot customer scenarios by doing labs 
Great Work Experience 
Great attitude of helping team members 
Very supportive managers
cons: Have to balance school and work

job_title: Industrial Engineer Intern in Maize, KS
pros: I have worked on two company projects dealing with Time and Motion study of processes, Value stream mapping, Lean application and Design and Documentation making myself a strong candidate for the post. I believe that my experience in Facilities planning will help to find the bottlenecks in the works done and improve production efficiency.
cons: I worked as a part time

review_title: It's just a student job but it was enjoyable.
pros: Meeting people, helping other students, getting a reputation around campus. I had a lot of people thank me for helping them with their class.
cons: Minimum wage with no benefits and only 10-15 hours a week. It's nice if you just need some side money but it's not really a real source of income.

review_title: Working at WSU was a great experience
pros: Work around your class schedule, on campus food so you don't have to leave the campus and lose parking, great faculty and administrators
cons: Not enough hours for student assistants, parking is a nightmare and if you have to leave it took at least 30 minutes to find a parking space when you get back

review_title: I thoroughly enjoyed my time working in the office of Admissions.
pros: As a student they worked well with your schedule, paid a decent salary, and was a fun place to work!
cons: The job seems to get repetitive throughout the year and year to year. You are doing the same thing every year, and there isn’t much change.

pros:
Very good people here.
Lots of freedom to do what you want to do.
Students are good people.
cons:
Funding.
Salary is very low.
Building that houses school is horrible.
Morale is extremely low.

pros: Stable, dependable hours with little work to actually do on a day to day basis
cons: Any idea for improvement is shot down almost immediately with little thought, discussion or inclusion of anyone that may be relevant to the situation.

pros: WSU is a good place to work but the salary is not that good. Benefits are ok. It is a state job so not a great deal of pressure work wise.
cons:
Salary is not competitive.
Upper management needs to work hard to motivate. 
Can be a dog house at times.

review_title: Great experience for a first job
pros:
Connections with the department you work with. I built a really good relationship with the Dean of Engineering. 
Get to do homework while working as well. 
On campus so you can just go to work in between classes. 
Free Coffee
cons: Deal with angry parents and students at times.

pros: Flexible hours. Lots of different kids. Children 6 weeks - 5 years of age. Great for a first job. Excellent management.
cons: Not enough hours for everyone. Have to find your own coverage. Some teachers have very strong opinions. Kids are very easily manipulated.

job_title: Library Student Assistant in Wichita, KS
pros: They let me make my own hours and as long as I was working 15 hours that week.
cons: Gets boring after a few hours of working

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Wichita, KS

review_title: Relax, you are working in a university

review_title: Lousy university to work for - if you are not White
pros: Low expectations.  Can get promoted even if you have no publications, research, etc.
